intro: Melicope monticola, commonly known as the mountain melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats on mountain slopes and is often found in rainforest environments. Its fruits are small, round, and turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. Melicope monticola plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat, providing food for local wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
